Topic.Title: Patents and Patent Applications of Local Corp

Message.Msg: Local Corporation Announces Record Mobile Search Traffic Press Release: Local Corporation – 1 hour 31 minutes ago.. . . IRVINE, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Local Corporation (LOCM), a leading online local media company, today announced record mobile search traffic for the second quarter of 2013. The company achieved mobile search traffic of 34 million monthly unique visitors (MUVs) during the second quarter 2013, up 79 percent from 19 million MUVs during the year ago period and up 6 percent from 32 million MUVs during the first quarter 2013. “With 80 percent of local searches expected to be done via a mobile device by 20181, mobile continues to reshape the local search landscape. We believe our growth in mobile illustrates that we are well-equipped for this transformation,” said Heath Clarke, Local Corporation chairman and CEO. “We are uniquely positioned with five patents issued in the mobile advertising format known as pay-per-call/mobile lead generation. We expect these will become the leading ad products for monetizing local mobile searches. With advertisers committing increasing budgets to mobile, our record mobile traffic and intellectual property represent an opportunity to capitalize on this trend.” According to BIA/Kelsey, U.S. local ad spending on mobile is expected to grow at a compound annual growth rate of 49.3 percent, from $1.2 billion in 2012, to $9.1 billion in 2017.

Message.Msg: Intent is first degree I believe. Your logic fails. Like G, you are unable to answer questions, only spewing the same old rhetoric like the obvious fact "following isn't illegal." What about types of following like stalking and harassing? Try to do that to someone and see if they don't call the police on your sorry behind. They will call the police and see what you are up to. It's just ike your clipping words, you only want to find ways to support your illogical theories. In other words, you're a certified rwnj. It was unjust to allow G to go on his own words, especially since he was walking around like it was coffee break at the police station, right after. No, he was not justified, and is the reason nuts like you and him are emboldened to be brave, and cause trouble with your concealed weapons protecting your cowardice. Better be faster on the draw than the other guy with one, that's quite a society you have created down there in the swamps. The unarmed child, and under the law he was such, did not have to die, period. Concrete sidewalks are not arms, only an insane person could use that logic. In the re-enactment video you can see G is not that fat or unfit, his arms look pretty good and he was using a punching bag. No way it was self defense, no way , no how. Topic.Title: Already a miscarriage of justice in Zimermen case because of political considerations

Message.Msg: Zimmerman stated that he reached in his pocket to pull out a phone and when he looked down Trayvon hit him. Well, not knowing what Zimmerman is going to pull out his pocket ... Isn't that a cause for Trayvon to fear for his life and try to protect himself from possible injury ? If someone was following me, got close and then reached into their pocket to pull something out, I probably would hit them first to protect myself ... not waiting to see what they pulled out ... it could be too late by then. --- Cops sometimes do the same thing ... they stop you and if you reach for something in your pocket ... they shoot you ... "Fearing For Their Lives". Trayvon was reasonable in striking first.

Topic.Title: Already a miscarriage of justice in Zimermen case because of political considerations

Message.Msg: "Well, not knowing what Zimmerman is going to pull out his pocket ... Isn't that a cause for Trayvon to fear for his life and try to protect himself from possible injury ? We can agree that the encounter was unfortunate. Misunderstandings, even those that end tragically, are not murder. Trayvon had no right to hit first, and certainly no right to keep hitting. It does not matter what Trayvon thought according to the law. He should have gone on home and Zimmerman would have never seen him anyway. It *IS* too bad, It *IS NOT* murder.

Topic.Title: Already a miscarriage of justice in Zimermen case because of political considerations

Message.Msg: No kid does that to a stranger approaching him at night in the rain. There is no way that happened like was made up in the videos. There is no logic to that at all. Zimmerman is lying or he would have told the truth from the start, and he didn't. And you gullible ones believe it. There is a true story, unfortunately Z hasn't told it. It's so obvious when he was caught he had to make up a story to fit, to get out of being charged like all criminals do. It doesn't fit. If he wasn't lying he would have testified and welcomed cross exam, being the only true alive witness, and did test screams so experts could prove it was him. He didn't because it will incriminate him. It's so so obvious. That poor child died for nothing. No punishment is enough.

Topic.Title: Go get 4, 50lb sacks of cement

Message.Msg: Cement is sold in 94 pound "bags" perhaps you meant sacks of concrete? Cement does not attempt to rise after each slam. Cement does not bend at the neck such that only 15 pounds need be manipulated to pound it. Cement bags that have bloody scars probably HAVE been pounded, regardless of lame attempts to suggest otherwise. Cement bags with broken noses may fear they are about to tear irreparably and defend themselves. It's too bad the young man over-estimated his abilities and too bad he mis judged his opponent. Youngsters dies every day making bad decisions to drive too fast or do some stupid stunt. It's too bad the lessons of life are so harsh for some of them. Since we are speculating, I speculate Trayvon was a wanna be tough racist punk. I doubt he would have jumped a black man. I speculate he thought he would kill a 'cracker" who dared to question his loitering in the rain and who over estimated his own badness as compared to the real world. I wish Trayvon were alive to learn and grow wiser. I genuinely feel the angst of his parents and regret their feeling the pain of losing a son but convicting a man with no evidence is not going to solve those issues.
